column6: All traffic must turn right at next intersection

column2: 3. Before turning left, it is important to:
column4: flash your headlights to alert the other drivers.
column6: sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: swing to the right side of your lane.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 5. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column6: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column8: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.

column2: 6. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column4: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.
column6: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.

column2: 7. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
8. This sign means:
column8: the road may be slippery when wet.
column10: no turns are allowed on this road.

column2: 9. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the speed limit on that route.
column6: the type of route you are on.
column8: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column10: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.

column2: 10. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column10: honk to let them know you’re there.

column2: 11. This sign indicates that the road ahead:
12. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column8: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.

column2: 13. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column8: before the traffic light turns red.

column2: 14. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: look for a detour or another route.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.
column10: remove the sign and move forward.

column2: 15. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column8: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column10: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.

17. This road sign means:
18. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 19. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column10: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 20. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: you may stop to let out passengers.
column6: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
column8: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column10: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.

22. This road sign means:
23. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
24. This road sign means:
column4: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution

column2: 25. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column4: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.
column6: speed up to beat the train.
column8: yield to all trains at the crossing.

column2: 26. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.
column6: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.
column8: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.
column10: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.

column2: 27. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: proceed with caution until you see a train.
column6: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.
column8: go through as soon as the first train passes.
column10: go through when one of the tracks is free.

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column6: Cars in right lane must slow down
column8: Pass only in the right lane

column2: 29. Drivers must stop for a pedestrian at an intersection:
column4: Only if the pedestrian is on their side of the road.
column6: if the pedestrian is in a marked or unmarked crosswalk.
column8: Only if the pedestrian is in a marked crosswalk.
column10: All the other answers are correct.

column2: 30. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column8: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column10: Drivers should walk more and drive less.

32. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column6: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column10: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.

column2: 33. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column6: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.
column10: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.

column2: 34. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column4: you see in your rearview mirror.
column8: you see in your side mirror.
column10: you cannot see without moving your head.

column2: 35. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column6: Not drinking over a period of time.
column10: Eating before or while you drink.
